content.question: Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is brought near Object <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>. Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> does not pick up Object <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>. Which of the following could be a correct claim about the material composition of Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>.

choices.label: Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is made of plastic.
Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is made of glass.
Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is paramagnetic.
Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is a magnet.

content.answer: Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is paramagnetic.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
